page.title: 04ST MARY'S HELICOPTER
page.content: {ISLAND TRANSPORT } We have a helicopter which travels between Scilly and Penzance.It is a Sikorsky S61 and they have had a Sikorsky since the service began in 1964.They moved the terminal in 1964 from one side of the airfield to the other.They use 40 gallons of kerosene for one trip.One helicopter lasts for 20 years before parts need replacing.They have 4 captains 1 senior officer 1 2nd officer.They carried 38,000 boxes of flowers in 1984.They carry 70,000 passengers per year and their record is 287 passengers a day.They don't have a fuel store they have a few drums spare.2932 other aircraft come to the airport and the biggest aircraft that has landed is a Dakota DC3 in an emergancy in the war.42 people are maintaining the Penzance to Scilly
